item.title: Danielle add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "It's the good girls who keep diaries; the bad girls never have the time." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Marilyn French
item.description: "S and M is only the expression in the bedroom of an oppressive-submissive relation which can happen also in the kitchen or at the factory, can happen between people of any gender. There is obviously something titillating about these relationships, but it isn't the sexual components that makes them ugly, they're uglier elsewhere. Nothing sexual is depraved. Only cruelty is depraved, and that's another matter." -- Marilyn French

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "This is how humans are: We question all our beliefs, except for the ones that we really believe in, and those we never think to question." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "She worked her toes into the sand, feeling the tiny delicious pain of the friction of tiny chips of silicon against the tender flesh between her toes. That's life. It hurts, it's dirty, and it feels very, very good." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description:
"Music isn't just a pleasure, a transient satisfaction. It's a need, a deep hunger; and when the music is right, it's joy. Love. A foretaste of heaven. A comfort in grief.
Is it too much to think that perhaps God speaks to us sometimes through music?
How, then, could I be so ungrateful as to refuse the message?" -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Danielle add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Pouring out liquor is like burning books." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Time doth flit; oh shit." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Stephen Elliott
item.description: "You'd be amazed how much fun you can have if you get out of your own head. The problem is that now people are only interested in themselves. What we have is a non-voting generation. That's what they should call you guys, the non-voting generation. You think you can't fix anything until you fix yourselves. Well, let me be the first to tell you, you will never fix yourselves. p.32 " -- Stephen Elliott

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Where you stumble and fall, there you will find gold." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Danielle add a quote by James St. James
Danielle add a quote by James St. James
item.description: "Tease hair, not homos!" -- James St. James

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "People aren't either wicked or noble. They're like chef's salads, with good things and bad things chopped and mixed together in a vinaigrette of confusion and conflict." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Well-read people are less likely to be evil." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is always cruel to laugh at people, of course, although sometimes if they are wearing an ugly hat it is hard to control yourself." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Danielle add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf." -- George Orwell

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Danielle add a quote by Mary Roach
item.description: "The way I see it, being dead is not terribly far off from being on a cruise ship. Most of your time is spent lying on your back. The brain has shut down. The flesh begins to soften. Nothing much new happens, and nothing is expected of you. " -- Mary Roach
